name: Grand Summit Resort Hotel at Mount Snow

reviews.title: Grand Time at the Summit
reviews.text: I was completely satisfied with my stay at the Grand Summit and hope to return next year. It was the most convenient skiing trip I've ever had. I loved the ski check and skiing right to the lifts. Once suggestion is for the hotel to provide rental services on the facility. The rooms were a little dingy but the full service spa/heated pool made up for them.

We've stayed at a number of different on-slope hotel-type rooms, and this experience was the tops. When we arrived on Friday night, they took our skis right at the door and also valet parked our car. When we got to the room, we were very pleasantly surprised by the amenities. Although the room was on the smaller side (as you would expect at a ski resort hotel room), they made excellent use of the space. The room also had a kitchenette with stove, dishwasher, and full-size refrigerator.
reviews.title: One of the best resort-run properties

reviews.text: The service also hit the mark. Usually, we run into some kinks that taints the overall experience, but the Mt. Snow staff had everything working smoothly. They even had the little things down pat, e.g. someone to grab the luggage cart for us (saving us an extra trip), cleaning service that took care of our room at the right times (other resorts either seem to send the cleaning staff too early, which is annoying as we're trying to head out the door, or too late, which is equally as annoying since we'd be looking forward to a clean room when we come back in for lunch).
reviews.title: Skip the Grand Summit

reviews.text: Can't say i love this place but i will definetely be going back before the season is over. The staff is very warm and friendly, but expect to get the typical laidback vermont attitude from them. The location of this hotel is fabulous, you ski right up to the door and they will take your skis for you (its not very far from the lift either). The food quality at the restaurant was decent but its not a very exciting place to be and its better just to head to some of the local places (great mexican and pubs near by). The outdoor pool is incredible, always fun and with great views of the slopes. I've stayed at ritz-carltons, four seasons, and mandarin orientals around the world, don't come expecting the ritz but you should come knowing that your going to have a good time :)
reviews.title: love this palce

reviews.text: Mount Snow has the best terrain in Southern Vermont but ASC does a terrible job of running it. I'm afraid the same is true for the Grand Summit, it could be a wonderful place to stay but mismanagement and poorly trained staff ruin it.
reviews.title: Grand Slummit Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are overpriced and the service is spotty at best. The staff was unable to answer even simple questions (I got the feeling everyone was a new hire). The MANDATORY valet parking at $15/night in addition to the room rate was also a big turn off.

Located in the renowned Green Mountains our idyllic, year-round resort is an incomparable staging ground for your outdoor vacation activities with family, or for a romantic getaway. We offer guests just about every amenity imaginable so there is truly something for everyone. This is in part why we’re fast becoming a leading wedding and conference destination. Let us help you begin your Grand Vermont adventure.
